arm_group.description: Patients who will be treated with Ascension HRA device.

brief_summary.textblock:
It is a non-randomized, consecutive enrollment, 10-year follow-up study of patients who are
      treated with the Ascension® HRA.  Its purpose is to measure and document the outcomes
      associated with implanting the Ascension HRA prosthesis.  Patients will be periodically
      assessed to collect data related to safety and effectiveness endpoints at the following
      intervals: preoperative, surgery/immediate post-op, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 2 year, 5
      year, and 10 years.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ascension® Humeral Resurfacing Arthroplasty Follow-Up Study
condition: Post-traumatic Arthrosis of Other Joints, Shoulder Region

detailed_description.textblock:
At each assessment interval, information on complications and adverse events will be
      collected.  In addition, shoulder joint range of motion will be collected, and implants will
      be evaluated radiographically to determine joint position and assess implant with regards to
      radiolucencies, subsidence and subluxation (migration).  Patient satisfaction with regard to
      the effect of the implant on shoulder function, joint pain, and overall satisfaction will be
      assessed using a visual analog scale (VAS).  Furthermore, if there are any implant revisions
      during the 10-year follow-up for any of the patients enrolled in the study, the implant
      and/or surrounding tissue will be harvested if possible and submitted for histopathological
      examination.

intervention.description: Patients who are treated with the Ascension® HRA for resurfacing of humeral head.

clinical_study.official_title: Ascension® Humeral Resurfacing Arthroplasty Follow-Up Study

overall_official.affiliation: Bay Pines VA Health Care System

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: The ASES score will be evaluated at 2 years and compared to baseline.
primary_outcome.measure: American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeon Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome data will be evaluated at 2 years

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Shoulder range of motion will be measured compared to baseline.
VAS score for pain will be evaluated at 2 years and compared to baseline.
Radiographs will be evaluated at 2 years for subsidence, lucent lines and evidence of movement or pending failure.
AEs will be assessed at each study timepoint

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
